pr_title: [FLINK-19627][table-runtime] Introduce multiple input operator for batch

timeline.bodyText: nit: use line comment instead of block comment

Input read order: the input with high priority (the value of read order is lower) + * will be read first, the inputs with same priorities will be read fairly. + */ +public class InputSelectionHandler { + private final List inputSpecs; + private final int numberOfInput; + /** + * All inputs ids sorted by priority. + */ + private final List> sortedAvailableInputs;

timeline.bodyText: Use LinkedList instead, as we need to remove its head frequently in endInput.
timeline.author: tsreaper
tsreaper

replies.bodyText: buildInputSelection already handles the null case

timeline.bodyText: Should be InputSelection.None according to the logic of endInput?

timeline.bodyText: This does not seem to be correct. See TableStreamOperator#computeMemorySize and its usage in SortMergeJoinOperator.
timeline.author: tsreaper

replies.bodyText: The problem is not caused here, but by the integer overflow at line 100 in BatchExecMultipleInputNode. I have fixed it.
replies.author: godfreyhe

timeline.message: [FLINK-19627][table-runtime] Introduce OneInput, FirstInputOfTwoInput, SecondInputOfTwoInput, InputSelectionHandler for multiple input operator
[FLINK-19627][table-runtime] Introduce different Output sub-classes for multiple input operator
[FLINK-19627][table-runtime] Introduce multiple input operator for batch
[FLINK-19627][table-runtime] Introduce multiple input operator for batch
